page.title: 03Principal Features Of Cupar
page.content: Apart from the obvious features-{ churches,schools and parks in Cupar, there is a great number of additional features in and around the town.The Cross (the ancient central trading area in Cupar),the Cattle Mart(held on Tuesdays),the War Memorial,Moat Hill,the Duncan Institute (now Cupar Library),the Corn Exchange,the Industrial Estate,Hawklaw (a M.O.D communications centre) and the River Eden which flows through the southern part of Cupar. The County Buildings are another feature. Situated in the centre of Cupar, they date from the Georgian period. Preservation in Cupar has not been overlooked, the most recent example being Crossgate House. It is now a supermarket, the facade of the original Georgian building having been restored and thereby preserved.
